org.cojen.tupl.ext

Interface ReplicationManager.Writer

  • Enclosing interface:
    ReplicationManager

    public static interface ReplicationManager.Writer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean confirm(long position)
      Blocks until all data up to the given log position is confirmed.
      boolean confirm(long position, long timeoutNanos)
      Blocks until all data up to the given log position is confirmed.
      boolean leaderNotify(Runnable callback)
      Invokes the given callback upon a leadership change.
      long position()
      Returns the next position a leader will write to.
      long write(byte[] b, int off, int len)
      Fully writes the given data, returning a potential confirmation position.
      default long writeCommit(byte[] b, int off, int len)
      Same as the regular write method, except that the message contains a transaction commit operation.

    • Method Detail

      • position

        long position()
        Returns the next position a leader will write to. Valid only if local instance is the leader.

      • leaderNotify

        boolean leaderNotify(Runnable callback)
        Invokes the given callback upon a leadership change. Callback should be invoked at most once, but extra invocations are ignored.
        Returns:
        false if not leader

      • write

        long write(byte[] b,
           int off,
           int len)
    throws IOException
        Fully writes the given data, returning a potential confirmation position. When the local instance loses leadership, all data rolls back to the highest confirmed position.
        Returns:
        potential confirmation position, or -1 if not leader
        Throws:
        IOException

      • writeCommit

        default long writeCommit(byte[] b,
                         int off,
                         int len)
                  throws IOException
        Same as the regular write method, except that the message contains a transaction commit operation. This variant exists to allow an implementation to capture the confirmation position of a transaction, in a thread-local variable.
        Returns:
        potential confirmation position, or -1 if not leader
        Throws:
        IOException

      • confirm

        default boolean confirm(long position)
                 throws IOException
        Blocks until all data up to the given log position is confirmed.
        Parameters:
        position - confirmation position as provided by the write method
        Returns:
        false if not leader
        Throws:
        ConfirmationFailureException
        IOException

      • confirm

        boolean confirm(long position,
                long timeoutNanos)
         throws IOException
        Blocks until all data up to the given log position is confirmed.
        Parameters:
        position - confirmation position as provided by the write method
        timeoutNanos - pass -1 for infinite
        Returns:
        false if not leader
        Throws:
        ConfirmationFailureException
        IOException
